definitions: To rid (someone or something) of an unwanted quality, condition, or feeling.
To remove a group of people from an organization or place in an abrupt or violent way.
To clear (the stomach or bowels) by evacuating them, especially by means of a laxative.
examples: He purged his mind of all doubts.
The new leader purged the party of dissidents.
The doctor purged the patient's system.
